required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Performance of the SOLTIVE Laser System for Laser Lithotripsy in Kidney or Ureteral Stones
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter, Post-Market Clinical Registry to Collect Real-World Evidence on the Clinical Performance of the SOLTIVE™ Laser for Treatment of Kidney or Ureteral Stones

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect real-world evidence on the performance of the SOLTIVE™ Premium SuperPulsed Laser System for laser lithotripsy in ureteroscopy, percutaneous nephrolithotomy (PCNL) and mini PCNL for kidney and ureteral stones.

primary_outcome.description: Stone free rate as determined by standard of care imaging

secondary_outcome.description: Measured from first to last footswitch press in minutes
Measured from time of initial ureteroscope insertion to time of ureteroscope withdrawal in minutes
Types of accessory devices used during the procedure (ureteroscopy, PCNL or mini-PCNL) and the total time used during the procedure in minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At procedure, immediate post-procedure, 1 month follow-up and 3 month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: AEs related to device or procedure and non-serious AEs related to device or procedure
Number of device deficiencies during the procedure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 1 month follow-up and 3 month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Types of treatments and/or interventions needed post-procedure at the follow-up visits and the number of times treatments and/or interventions were performed

arm_group.description: Subjects who have a medical indication for ureteroscopy, percutaneous nephrolithotomy (PCNL) or mini PCNL

intervention.intervention_name: SOLTIVE™ Premium SuperPulsed Laser Fiber System
intervention.description: SOLTIVE™ SuperPulsed Laser Fiber System and SOLTIVE™ Laser Fibers for single-use only

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. ≥18 years of age
2. Medical indication for ureteroscopy, percutaneous nephrolithotomy (PCNL) or mini PCNL
3. Willing and able to provide informed consent
4. Female and of childbearing age with a negative pregnancy test
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Contraindicated for uteroscopy, PCNL or mini PCNL as determined by the physician
2. Inability to tolerate anesthesia for any reason
3. Unable or unwilling to provide informed consent
4. Concurrently participating in another competing clinical study
5. Known ureteral stricture
6. Unwilling or unable to return for follow-up

patient_data.ipd_description: Subject data collected during the study after de-identification.
